intro: Euphrasia cantabrica, commonly known as the Cantabrian eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in mountainous regions. It has hairy, linear leaves and is known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine. Euphrasia cantabrica is also valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators.
